etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin marcasita, from Arabic marqašīṯa, from Persian

definitions: a semiprecious stone consisting of pyrite.
shortDefinitions: semi-precious stone consisting of iron pyrites

definitions: a bronze-yellow mineral consisting of iron disulfide but differing from pyrite in typically forming aggregates of tabular crystals.
shortDefinitions: bronze-yellow mineral consisting of iron disulphide

definitions: a piece of polished steel or a similar metal cut as a gem.
shortDefinitions: piece of polished steel or similar metal cut as gem
